channel.title: Crime Library
channel.description:
I found this site a while ago and it had me hooked, I spent hours reading these stories about notorious minds. I've always had an interest in psychology and it was interesting to read about these famous minds , how they work and they plan their victims etc.
www.crimelibrary.com
www.mycrimespace.com - Thanks to Ilyaostr
Check it out, it may be more interesting than you think :)
~ VG_Kobra

item.title: Crime Library
item.dc:creator: @VG_Kobra VG_Kobra
item.description:
@VG_Kobra wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:22, topic:21765”][quote]Alaskan serial killer lured women to his cabin, brutalized them and then released them in the wilderness to attempt their escapes. But then, he sadistically went after them and hunted them down like wild animals.
Famed former FBI profiler John Douglas had been asked by police to look into Hansen as a suspect. He took note of the fact that Hansen was of small stature, heavily pockmarked and suffered from a severe speech impediment. Due to Hansen’s unsightly looks, Douglas surmised that he suffered from severe skin problems as an adolescent and was probably teased by his peers. In turn, he would have low self-esteem, which would have prompted him to live in an isolated area. Douglas considered the abuse of prostitutes a way for perpetrators to get back at women.

[/quote]
THis should be an interesting read. It sounds exactly like this movie I watched one time.[/quote]

Most of the psychos seem to be born from childhood irregularities, ex: The MAry Bell girl was presumed psychipathic after she consumed her mothers medication which were lying on the ground when she was small.

Read full topic

item.title: Crime Library
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Alaskan serial killer lured women to his cabin, brutalized them and then released them in the wilderness to attempt their escapes. But then, he sadistically went after them and hunted them down like wild animals. Famed former FBI profiler John Douglas had been asked by police to look into Hansen as a suspect. He took note of the fact that Hansen was of small stature, heavily pockmarked and suffered from a severe speech impediment. Due to Hansen's unsightly looks, Douglas surmised that he suffered from severe skin problems as an adolescent and was probably teased by his peers. In turn, he would have low self-esteem, which would have prompted him to live in an isolated area. Douglas considered the abuse of prostitutes a way for perpetrators to get back at women.
THis should be an interesting read. It sounds exactly like this movie I watched one time.

Read full topic

item.title: Crime Library
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

So far I’ve heard of all the killers you have listed except for the little girl. I’ve heard of the BTK killer and saw some weird movie about him, I saw a Cold case file episode about the Zodiac Killer and Dohmer was in the state I live in… Thanks for the intresting find it keeps me occupied

Read full topic

item.title: Crime Library
item.dc:creator: @VG_Kobra VG_Kobra
item.description:
@VG_Kobra wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:19, topic:21765”][quote author=VG_Kobra link=topic=33170.msg408321#msg408321 date=1162770586]

I cleaned alot of spams and flames out of this thread, keep it clean from now on.

<3 Mopar the Uber Janitor
[/quote]

What do you think we pay him overtime for? :)[/quote]

Sex?

On Topic: If you’ve ran out of topics on Crime Library your pretty dense, do not know how to use the search button or just too lazy (or maybe all 3) But I’m nice so I’ll give you an interesting one. Look up BTK. He was a very famous serial killer who was just caught a while ago. They caught him by tracking his floppy disk ID (he used to send them to the police to tease them) back to the computer in which he wrote them with. ( I won’t spoil the ending look it up yourself :D)

Read full topic

item.title: Crime Library
item.dc:creator: @VG_Kobra VG_Kobra
item.description:
@VG_Kobra wrote:

Thanks Kane and JME

Yea it really is interesting to read about psychopaths, although I think the 10 year old was more toward curiosity and psychoness than refined killing techniques

Call me a sadist by I like reading the ones where they actually plan it out, its interesting to read their techniques, plans how they thought of it than just how he got a revelation and went on a killing rampage

You should read about John Wayne Gacy and Ted Bundy. One of the most notorious serial killers in America.

Read full topic

item.title: Crime Library
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Not completly on topic but it’s intresting.

The London Gazette. My mum showed it to me(she works for Plymouth Citizen Advice Beuro) and basically, the Gazette is a news paper about leagal process’s that occur in courts. Since I’ve never actually read the paper I can’t explain more.

Although UK based, it’s intresting. Linky.

Read full topic

Anyways, I’m reading that artcile about the 10 year old murderer. It’s very interesting. I find that they use a crapload of comma splice errors on this site though
